contextId.information: This refers to righteous and wicked people. AT: "those who are righteous ... those who are wicked" or "the righteous people ... the wicked people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])

This refers to people with low status and people who are exalted. AT: "those who are lowly ... those who are exalted" or "those with low status ... those with high status" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
This refers to wicked people. AT: "those who are wicked" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])

This refers to unclean and clean things. Something that God considers spiritually unacceptable or defiled is spoken of as if it were physically unclean. AT: "things that are unclean and things that are clean" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This refers to his dead wife. AT: "your dead wife" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
Here purple cloth or yarn is referred to by just its color. AT: "purple cloth" or "purple yarn" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
The nominal adjective "the wicked" can be stated as "the wicked person." AT: "to the wicked person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
